   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between six Diameter nodes connected as follows.
   23: %%
   24: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM1  (TLS after capabilities exchange)
   25: %%                /
   26: %%               /  ---- SERVER.REALM2  (ditto)
   27: %%              | /
   28: %%   CLIENT.REALM0 ----- SERVER.REALM3  (no security)
   29: %%              | \
   30: %%               \  ---- SERVER.REALM4  (TLS at connection establishment)
   31: %%                \
   32: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM5  (ditto)
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: -module(diameter_tls_SUITE).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   38: -export([run/0]).
   39: 
   40: %% common_test wrapping
   41: -export([
   42:          %% Framework functions
   43:          suite/0,
   44:          all/0,
   45:          init_per_suite/1,
   46:          end_per_suite/1,
   47:         
   48:          %% The test cases
   49:          parallel/1
   50:         ]).
   51: 
   52: %% diameter callbacks
   53: -export([prepare_request/3,
   54:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   55:          handle_answer/4,
   56:          handle_request/3]).
   57: 
   58: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   59: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   60: 
   61: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   62: 
   63: 
   64: %% ===========================================================================
   65: 
   66: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   67: 
   68: -define(CLIENT,  "CLIENT.REALM0").
   69: -define(SERVER1, "SERVER.REALM1").
   70: -define(SERVER2, "SERVER.REALM2").
   71: -define(SERVER3, "SERVER.REALM3").
   72: -define(SERVER4, "SERVER.REALM4").
   73: -define(SERVER5, "SERVER.REALM5").
   74: 
   75: -define(SERVERS, [?SERVER1, ?SERVER2, ?SERVER3, ?SERVER4, ?SERVER5]).
   76: 
   77: -define(DICT_COMMON,  ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   78: 
   79: -define(APP_ALIAS, the_app).
   80: -define(APP_ID, ?DICT_COMMON:id()).
   81: 
   82: -define(NO_INBAND_SECURITY, 0).
   83: -define(TLS, 1).
   84: 
   85: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   86: -define(SERVICE(Host, Dict),
   87:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   88:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   89:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   90:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   91:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   92:          {'Inband-Security-Id', [?NO_INBAND_SECURITY]},
   93:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [Dict:id()]},
   94:          {application, [{alias, ?APP_ALIAS},
   95:                         {dictionary, Dict},
   96:                         {module, #diameter_callback{peer_up = false,
   97:                                                     peer_down = false,
   98:                                                     pick_peer = false,
   99:                                                     handle_error = false,
  100:                                                     default = ?MODULE}},
  101:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
  102: 
  103: %% Config for diameter:add_transport/2. In the listening case, listen
  104: %% on a free port that we then lookup using the implementation detail
  105: %% that diameter_tcp registers the port with diameter_reg.
  106: -define(TCONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts),
  107:         {connect, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  108:                    {transport_config, [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  109:                                        {rport, PortNr},
  110:                                        {ip, ?ADDR},
  111:                                        {port, 0}
  112:                                        | Opts]},
  113:                    {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  114: -define(TLISTEN(Caps, Opts),
  115:         {listen, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  116:                   {transport_config, [{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | Opts]},
  117:                   {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  118: 
  119: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
  120: -define(LOGOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  121: 
  122: -define(TL(F),    ?TL(F, [])).
  123: -define(TL(F, A), ?LOG("DTLSS", F, A)).
  124: 
  125: 
  126: %% ===========================================================================
  127: %% common_test wrapping
  128: 
  129: suite() ->
  130:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  131: 
  132: all() ->
  133:     [parallel].
  134: 
  135: %% Shouldn't really have to know about crypto here but 'ok' from
  136: %% ssl:start() isn't enough to guarantee that TLS is available.
  137: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  138:     Config2 = ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config),
  139:     try
  140:         [] == (catch make_certs(dir(Config2)))
  141:             orelse throw({?MODULE, no_certs}),
  142:         ok == application:start(crypto) orelse throw({?MODULE, no_crypto}),
  143:         ok == ssl:start() orelse throw({?MODULE, no_ssl}),
  144:         Config2
  145:     catch
  146:         {?MODULE, E} ->
  147:             {skip, E}
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  151:     ssl:stop(),
  152:     application:stop(crypto),
  153:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  154: 
  155: parallel(Config) ->
  156:     ?TL("parallel -> entry"),
  157:     Res = run(dir(Config), false),
  158:     ?TL("parallel -> done when"
  159:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  160:     Res.
  161: 
  162: dir(Config) ->
  163:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
  164: 
  165: 
  166: %% ===========================================================================
  167: 
  168: run() ->
  169:     Tmp = ?MKTEMP("diameter_tls"),
  170:     try
  171:         run(Tmp, true)
  172:     after
  173:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: run(Dir, B) ->
  177:     ?TL("run -> start crypto"),
  178:     application:start(crypto),
  179:     ?TL("run -> start ssl"),
  180:     ssl:start(),
  181:     try
  182:         ?TL("run -> try run traffic"),
  183:         ?RUN([{[fun traffic/2, Dir, B], 60000}])
  184:     after
  185:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop diameter"),
  186:         diameter:stop(),
  187:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop ssl"),
  188:         ssl:stop(),
  189:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop crypto"),
  190:         application:stop(crypto),
  191:         ?TL("run(after) -> done"),
  192:         ok
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: traffic(Dir, true) ->
  196:     ?TL("traffic(true) -> make certs"),
  197:     [] = make_certs(Dir),
  198:     traffic(Dir, false);
  199: 
  200: traffic(Dir, false) ->
  201:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> start diameter"),
  202:     ok = diameter:start(),
  203:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> start (diameter) services"),
  204:     Servers = start_services(Dir),
  205:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> add transports"),
  206:     Connections = add_transports(Dir, Servers),
  207:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> calls"),
  208:     [] = ?RUN([[fun call/1, S] || S <- ?SCRAMBLE(?SERVERS)]),
  209:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> remove transports"),
  210:     [] = remove_transports(Connections),
  211:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> stop (diameter) services"),
  212:     [] = stop_services(),
  213:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> done"),
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: make_certs(Dir) ->
  217:     ?RUN([[fun make_cert/2, Dir, B] || B <- ["server1",
  218:                                              "server2",
  219:                                              "server4",
  220:                                              "server5",
  221:                                              "client"]]).
  222: 
  223: start_services(Dir) ->
  224:     Servers = [{S, {_,_} = server(S, sopts(S, Dir))} || S <- ?SERVERS],
  225:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, ?SERVICE(?CLIENT, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  226:     Servers.
  227: 
  228: add_transports(Dir, Servers) ->
  229:     true = diameter:subscribe(?CLIENT),
  230:     Opts = ssl_options(Dir, "client"),
  231:     [{N, S, connect(?CLIENT, S, copts(N, Opts))} || {N,S} <- Servers].
  232: 
  233: %% Remove the client transports and expect the corresponding server
  234: %% transport to go down.
  235: remove_transports(Connections) ->
  236:     [] = [T || S <- ?SERVERS, T <- [diameter:subscribe(S)], T /= true],
  237:     [] = ?RUN([[fun disconnect/1, T] || T <- Connections]),
  238:     [S || S <- ?SERVERS,
  239:           I <- [receive #diameter_event{service = S, info = I} -> I end],
  240:           down /= catch element(1, I)].
  241: 
  242: disconnect({_, {_LRef, _PortNr}, CRef}) ->
  243:     ok = diameter:remove_transport(?CLIENT, CRef).
  244: 
  245: stop_services() ->
  246:     [{H,T} || H <- [?CLIENT | ?SERVERS],
  247:               T <- [diameter:stop_service(H)],
  248:               T /= ok].
  249: 
  250: %% ===========================================================================
  251: %% diameter callbacks
  252: 
  253: %% prepare_request/3
  254: 
  255: prepare_request(#diameter_packet{msg = Req},
  256:                 ?CLIENT,
  257:                 {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  258:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  259:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  260:         = Caps,
  261: 
  262:     {send, set(Req, [{'Session-Id', diameter:session_id(OH)},
  263:                      {'Origin-Host',  OH},
  264:                      {'Origin-Realm', OR}])}.
  265: 
  266: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  267: 
  268: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer) ->
  269:     discard.
  270: 
  271: %% handle_answer/4
  272: 
  273: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  274:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  275:     Rec.
  276: 
  277: %% handle_request/3
  278: 
  279: handle_request(#diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}},
  280:                OH,
  281:                {_Ref, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,_},
  282:                                      origin_realm = {OR, _}}})
  283:   when OH /= ?CLIENT ->
  284:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  285:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  286:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  287:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}}.
  288: 
  289: %% ===========================================================================
  290: %% support functions
  291: 
  292: %% Send an STR intended for a specific server and expect success.
  293: call(Server) ->
  294:     ?TL("call -> entry with"
  295:         "~n   Server: ~p", [Server]),
  296:     Realm = realm(Server),
  297:     Req = ['STR', {'Destination-Realm', Realm},
  298:                   {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  299:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}],
  300:     ?TL("call -> make (STR) call (with filter and realm) - expect STA"),
  301:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code'  = ?SUCCESS,
  302:                        'Origin-Host'  = Server,
  303:                        'Origin-Realm' = Realm}
  304:         = call(Req, [{filter, realm}]),
  305:     ?TL("call -> done"),
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: call(Req, Opts) ->
  309:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?APP_ALIAS, Req, Opts).
  310: 
  311: set([H|T], Vs) ->
  312:     [H | Vs ++ T].
  313: 
  314: realm(Host) ->
  315:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
  316: 
  317: inband_security(Ids) ->
  318:     [{'Inband-Security-Id', Ids}].
  319: 
  320: ssl_options(Dir, Base) ->
  321:     Root = filename:join([Dir, Base]),
  322:     [{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_none},{certfile, Root ++ "_ca.pem"},
  323:                     {keyfile,  Root ++ "_key.pem"}]}].
  324: 
  325: make_cert(Dir, Base) ->
  326:     make_cert(Dir, Base ++ "_key.pem", Base ++ "_ca.pem").
  327: 
  328: make_cert(Dir, Keyfile, Certfile) ->
  329:     [KP,CP] = [filename:join([Dir, F]) || F <- [Keyfile, Certfile]],
  330: 
  331:     KC = join(["openssl genrsa -out", KP, "2048"]),
  332:     CC = join(["openssl req -new -sha256 -x509 -key", KP, "-out", CP, "-days 7",
  333:                "-subj /C=SE/ST=./L=Stockholm/CN=www.erlang.org"]),
  334: 
  335:     %% Hope for the best and only check that files are written.
  336:     KR = os:cmd(KC),
  337:     {_, {ok, _}} = {KR, file:read_file_info(KP)},
  338:     CR = os:cmd(CC),
  339:     {_, {ok, _}} = {CR, file:read_file_info(CP)},
  340: 
  341:     {KP,CP}.
  342: 
  343: join(Strs) ->
  344:     string:join(Strs, " ").
  345: 
  346: %% server/2
  347: 
  348: server(Host, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  349:     ok = diameter:start_service(Host, ?SERVICE(Host, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  350:     {ok, LRef} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?TLISTEN(Caps, Opts)),
  351:     {LRef, hd([_] = ?LPORT(tcp, LRef))}.
  352: 
  353: sopts(?SERVER1, Dir) ->
  354:     {inband_security([?TLS]),
  355:      ssl_options(Dir, "server1")};
  356: sopts(?SERVER2, Dir) ->
  357:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]),
  358:      ssl_options(Dir, "server2")};
  359: sopts(?SERVER3, _) ->
  360:     {[], []};
  361: sopts(?SERVER4, Dir) ->
  362:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server4"))};
  363: sopts(?SERVER5, Dir) ->
  364:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server5"))}.
  365: 
  366: ssl([{ssl_options = T, Opts}]) ->
  367:     [{T, true} | Opts].
  368: 
  369: %% connect/3
  370: 
  371: connect(Host, {_LRef, PortNr}, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  372:     {ok, Ref} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?TCONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts)),
  373:     {up, Ref, _, _, #diameter_packet{}}
  374:          = receive
  375:                #diameter_event{service = Host, info = Info}
  376:                  when element(2, Info) == Ref ->
  377:                    Info
  378:            end,
  379:     Ref.
  380: 
  381: copts(S, Opts)
  382:   when S == ?SERVER1;
  383:        S == ?SERVER2;
  384:        S == ?SERVER3 ->
  385:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]), Opts};
  386: copts(S, Opts)
  387:   when S == ?SERVER4;
  388:        S == ?SERVER5 ->
  389:     {[], ssl(Opts)}.
